events.title: Lorenzo Snow's Birth
events.description: Lorenzo Snow, the fifth president of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints, was born.
events.significance: He played a crucial role in the development of the LDS church and its doctrines.

events.title: First Woman Prime Minister in the World
events.description: Alexandra Kollontai became the world's first woman ambassador, appointed by Soviet Russia to Norway.
events.significance: This appointment marked a significant advance for women in government positions internationally.

events.title: The Beatles Release 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band'
events.description: The Beatles released their landmark album 'Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band' in the United Kingdom.
events.significance: This album revolutionized popular music and is considered one of the greatest albums of all time.

events.title: Greece Joins NATO
events.description: Greece officially joined the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
events.significance: This expansion strengthened NATO's presence in the Mediterranean region during the Cold War.

events.title: Death of Michael Jackson
events.description: Michael Jackson, the 'King of Pop', died from acute propofol and benzodiazepine intoxication.
events.significance: His death marked the loss of one of the most influential entertainers in music history.
